==Events==
* [[325]] &ndash; The [[First Council of Nicea]] &ndash; the first [[Ecumenical Council]] of the [[Christian Church]] is held.
* [[491]] &ndash; Empress [[Ariadne (empress)|Ariadne]] marries [[Anastasius I (emperor)|Anastasius I]]. The widowed ''[[Augusta (honorific)|Augusta]]'' is able to choose her successor for the [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] throne, after [[Zeno (emperor)|Zeno]] (late emperor) dies of [[dysentery]].
* [[526]] &ndash; An [[526 Antioch earthquake|earthquake]] kills about 250,000 people in what is now [[Syria]] and [[Antioch]]ia.
* [[685]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Dun Nechtain]] is fought between a [[Picts|Pictish]] army under King [[Bridei III]] and the invading [[Northumbrians]] under King [[Ecgfrith of Northumbria|Ecgfrith]], who are decisively defeated.
*[[1217]] &ndash; The [[Second Battle of Lincoln]] is fought near [[Lincoln, Lincolnshire|Lincoln]], England, resulting in the defeat of [[Louis VIII of France|Prince Louis of France]] by [[William Marshal, 1st Earl of Pembroke]].
*[[1293]] &ndash; King [[Sancho IV of Castile]] creates the [[Universidad Complutense de Madrid|Study of General Schools of Alcalá]].
*[[1449]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Alfarrobeira]] is fought, establishing the [[House of Braganza]] as a principal royal family of Portugal.
*[[1497]] &ndash; [[John Cabot]] sets sail from [[Bristol]], England, on his ship {{Ship||Matthew|ship|6}} looking for a route to the west (other documents give a [[May 2]] date).
*[[1498]] &ndash; Portuguese explorer [[Vasco da Gama]] [[Discovery of the sea route to India|discovers the sea route to India]] when he arrives at [[Kozhikode]] (previously known as Calicut), India.
*[[1520]] &ndash; The [[The massacre in the Main Temple|massacre at the festival of Tóxcatl]] takes place during the [[Fall of Tenochtitlan]], resulting in turning the Aztecs against the Spanish.
*[[1521]] &ndash; [[Ignatius Loyola]] is seriously wounded in the [[Battle of Pampeluna]].
*[[1570]] &ndash; [[Cartography|Cartographer]] [[Abraham Ortelius]] issues ''[[Theatrum Orbis Terrarum]]'', the first modern [[atlas]].
*[[1609]] &ndash; [[Shakespeare's sonnets]] are first published in London, perhaps illicitly, by the [[publisher]] [[Thomas Thorpe]].
*[[1631]] &ndash; The city of [[Magdeburg]] in Germany is seized by forces of the [[Holy Roman Empire]] and most of its inhabitants [[Sack of Magdeburg|massacred]], in one of the bloodiest incidents of the [[Thirty Years' War]].
*[[1645]]&ndash;The [[Manchurian]] [[Qing]] army occupied the city [[Yangzhou]] and the residents get [[massacred]] for 10 days long. Hundred thousands of people get killed by the Qing troops
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[Mecklenburg Declaration of Independence]] is signed in [[Charlotte, North Carolina|Charlotte]], [[North Carolina]]
*[[1802]] &ndash; By the [[Law of 20 May 1802]], [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon Bonaparte]] reinstates [[slavery]] in the [[French colonial empire|French colonies]], revoking its abolition in the [[French Revolution]]
*[[1813]] &ndash; Napoleon Bonaparte leads his French troops into the [[Battle of Bautzen]] in [[Saxony]], Germany, against the combined armies of Russia and [[Prussia]]. The battle ends the next day with a French victory.
*[[1840]] &ndash; [[York Minster]] is badly damaged by fire.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The state of [[Kentucky]] proclaims its [[neutral country|neutrality]], which will last until [[September 3]] when [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] forces enter the state. Meanwhile, the State of North Carolina secedes from the Union.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] signs the [[Homestead Act]] into law.
*[[1864]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Ware Bottom Church]] &ndash; in the [[Virginia]] [[Bermuda Hundred Campaign]], 10,000 troops fight in this Confederate victory.
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Levi Strauss]] and [[Jacob Davis (inventor)|Jacob Davis]] receive a U.S. [[patent]] for blue [[jeans]] with [[copper]] rivets.
*[[1875]] &ndash; Signing of the [[Metre Convention]] by 17 nations leading to the establishment of the [[International System of Units]].
*[[1882]] &ndash; The [[Triple Alliance (1882)|Triple Alliance]] between the German Empire, [[Austria-Hungary]] and the [[Kingdom of Italy]] is formed.
*[[1883]] &ndash; [[Krakatoa]] [[1883 eruption of Krakatoa|begins to erupt]]; the volcano explodes three months later, killing more than 36,000 people.
*[[1884]] &ndash; [[Dinuzulu kaCetshwayo]] becomes the king of the Zulu Nation.
*[[1891]] &ndash; [[History of cinema]]: The first public display of [[Thomas Edison]]'s prototype [[kinetoscope]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; The six ton [[chandelier]] of the [[Palais Garnier]] falls on the crowd below resulting in the death of one and the injury of many others.
*[[1899]] &ndash; The first [[traffic ticket]] in the US: New York City taxi driver Jacob German was arrested for speeding while driving 12 miles per hour on Lexington Street.
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[Cuba]] gains independence from the United States. [[Tomás Estrada Palma]] becomes the country's first [[List of Presidents of Cuba|President]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Budi Utomo]] organization is founded in [[Dutch East Indies]], beginning the [[Indonesian National Awakening]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; The ''[[Saturday Evening Post]]'' publishes its first cover with a [[Norman Rockwell]] painting (''Boy with Baby Carriage'').
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]] [[radio station]] [[XWA]] broadcasts the first regularly scheduled [[radio]] programming in North America.
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Jeddah (1927)|Treaty of Jeddah]]: the United Kingdom recognizes the [[sovereignty]] of King [[Ibn Saud]] in the Kingdoms of [[Hejaz]] and [[Najd|Nejd]], which later merge to become the Kingdom of [[Saudi Arabia]].
*  1927   &ndash; At 07:52 [[Charles Lindbergh]] takes off from [[Roosevelt Field]] in [[Long Island]], New York, on the world's first solo non-stop flight across the Atlantic Ocean. He touched down at [[Le Bourget Airport|Le Bourget Field]] in Paris at 22:22 the next day.
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Amelia Earhart]] takes off from [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]] to begin the world's first solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic Ocean by a female pilot, landing in Ireland the next day.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: The first prisoners arrive at a new [[concentration camp]] at [[Auschwitz]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Crete]] &ndash; [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[Fallschirmjäger (World War II)|paratroops]] invade [[Crete]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Chiang Kai-shek]] is elected as the first [[President of the Republic of China]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; In the United States, the Armed Forces Security Agency, the predecessor to the [[National Security Agency]], is established.
*[[1956]] &ndash; In [[Operation Redwing]], the first United States airborne [[hydrogen bomb]] is dropped over [[Bikini Atoll]] in the Pacific Ocean.
*[[1964]] &ndash; Discovery of the [[cosmic microwave background radiation]] by [[Robert Woodrow Wilson]] and [[Arno Penzias]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[PIA Flight 705]], a [[Pakistan International Airlines]] [[Boeing 720|Boeing 720-040B]], crashes while descending to land at [[Cairo International Airport]], killing 121 of the 127 passengers and crew.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Popular Movement of the Revolution]] [[political party]] is established in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Operation OAU]] begins during the [[Nigerian Civil War]]
*[[1969]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Hamburger Hill]] in [[Vietnam]] ends.
*[[1980]] &ndash; In a [[1980 Quebec referendum|referendum]] in Quebec, the population rejects by a 60% vote the proposal from its government to move towards independence from Canada.
*[[1983]] &ndash; First publications of the discovery of the [[HIV]] [[virus]] that causes [[AIDS]] in the journal ''[[Science (journal)|Science]]'' by [[Luc Montagnier]].
*  1983   &ndash; The [[Church Street bombing]] in the South African capital [[Pretoria]]. The bombing killed 19 and wounded 217.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Radio Martí]], part of the [[Voice of America]] service, begins broadcasting to [[Cuba]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; The Chinese authorities declare martial law in the face of pro-[[democracy]] demonstrations, setting the scene for the [[Tiananmen Square massacre]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; The first post-[[communism|Communist]] presidential and parliamentary elections are held in [[Romania]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[LGBT rights in the United States|Civil rights]]: The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules in ''[[Romer v. Evans]]'' against a law that would have prevented any city, town or county in the state of [[Colorado]] from taking any legislative, executive, or judicial action to protect the rights of [[Homosexuality|gays and lesbians]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; The independence of [[East Timor]] is recognized by Portugal, formally ending 23 years of [[Indonesia]]n rule and three years of provisional UN administration (Portugal itself is the former [[Portuguese Empire|colonizer]] of East Timor until 1976).
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[2006 Dhaka strikes|Dhaka wildcat strikes]]: A series of massive strikes begin, involving nearly 1.8 million garment workers in [[Bangladesh]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; At least 27 people are killed and 50 others injured when a [[2012 Northern Italy earthquakes|6.0-magnitude earthquake]] strikes northern [[Italy]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; An [[Enhanced Fujita Scale|EF5]] [[2013 Moore tornado|tornado]] strikes the Oklahoma City suburb of [[Moore, Oklahoma|Moore]], killing 24 people and injuring 377 others.
*[[2014]] &ndash; More than 118 people are killed in [[May 2014 Jos bombings|two bombings]] in [[Jos]], [[Nigeria]].
